post_text: GCS is following DHEC guidelines for excluding students and teachers from school when an individual is exhibiting symptoms, has been tested for COVID-19, is a confirmed positive case, or has been exposed (within six feet of a positive case for more than 15 minutes) to this virus. To be safe, we are asking families to notify their school(s) anytime there is a concern related to COVID-19 so we can provide guidance based on DHEC regulations. We also want families who have traveled internationally to follow all quarantine directives they receive when re-entering the country. Anyone who has been directed to quarantine when re-entering the country should not attend school for the period of the quarantine – usually 14 days. We have posted this graphic on the GCS website that represents the steps that should be taken to return safely to school in numerous COVID-19 situations. There is also a 12-question quiz https://bit.ly/34zlxsm to help you test your knowledge, but be warned, it is not easy.

The football schedule will be subject to the GCS Attendance Plan of at least one day of in-person school and the COVID spread rate. Please note that plans for spectators at football games are not finalized at this time. Any plans will include social distancing and other safety protocols. The SCHSL is considering instituting limits on spectators, either by numbers or by percentage of occupancy limits, but may also leave this determination up to individual districts. Meanwhile, players and coaches will practice social-distancing whenever possible, including the trip to and from games and while using locker facilities. Additionally, the district purchased 4,000 buff-style masks for student athletes to use during practice and game play.

Project SEARCH is a unique, business-led, one-year employment preparation program that has taken place entirely at Bon Secours St. Francis Hospital. Total workplace immersion facilitates a seamless combination of classroom instruction, career exploration, and hands-on training through worksite rotations. The program culminates in individualized job development. We are so very grateful for our partnership with Bon Secours St. Francis and are extremely proud of our interns. Congratulations to all who received completion certificates!

Greenville County Schools is asking ALL families who will have a student or students enrolled for the 2020-21 school year to complete a new Transportation Request Form. The form should be completed for EVERY student, including bus riders, car riders, walkers, bicyclists, and daycare bus riders. Complete this form https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdqwj7gi5zQ0roqNZyzEDnDXNT2s60qesSCWeBd5zhHzJ3Reg/viewform

It is very important to complete the form so GCS can efficiently plan for how students will arrive and depart campuses daily. It is particularly important for students who have moved or changed schools.

In order to ensure school bus transportation on the first day of school, forms are due by Friday, July 31. School bus requests submitted after July 31 will not be routed until after Labor Day.

Due to weather predicted on Wednesday during our scheduled #BeTheLight Senior Celebration, Greenville County Schools is postponing the event until Wednesday, May 27th.

This event was designed to give faculty and staff from the schools the opportunity, while appropriately maintaining social distance, a way to visually celebrate the seniors as students drive through the campus. The inclement weather would reduce the availability to have faculty and staff outside in the elements, and the decision to reschedule was made in hopes that the possibility of better weather next week would allow for a more enjoyable experience for the students and staff.

As part of the #BeTheLight Celebration, all Greenville County Schools Athletics Complex lights that were scheduled to be turned on for the Class of 2020 will also be postponed until next Wednesday, the 27th.

On Wednesday, May 20, we plan to celebrate the Class of 2020 with a #bethelight campaign. High schools are scheduling drive-through events for seniors at their schools and all high school football stadium lights will burn for a period of time that evening. Here are some examples of what you can do to celebrate graduating seniors:
• Turn on your porch lights from 6- 10 p.m. on Wednesday, May 20 so seniors can see them while on their way to/from their drive-through celebrations
• Put sign/balloons/streamers in your front yard supporting the Class of 2020
• Decorate your mailbox with your high school’s colors and logos
• Wear your favorite high school colors on Wednesday, May 20
• Go to your front yard at 8:20 for 20 minutes on May 20 and wave your phone or a flashlight
• Send in pics of families under the lamplight or with yard signs/decorations to BetheLight@greenville.k12.sc.us.
Download the #bethelight sign here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=18AqHla_wPv4YpLU0a7EVd_vBzJGYQHa2

post_text: The School Improvement Council of Chandler Creek Elementary School has earned the SC-SIC’s Report to the Parents Annual Award of Merit! Starting this Friday, Greenville County students who pick up meals from any school feeding site will receive three breakfasts and three lunches to supply them with meals for the entire weekend. This expanded service is made possible by a new waiver from the USDA. By supplying students with enough meals for Friday, Saturday and Sunday, GCS meal output will increase by 44,000 per week (22,000 meals each day for two days.)

These meals are funded through the National School Lunch Program Seamless Summer Option (SSO). Last week, Urban and his team reached a milestone of over 500,000 meals served since the start of the COVID-19 school shutdown.

“I am tremendously proud of all the GCS staff that have stepped up to take care of our community during this crisis,” Urban said.

post_text: GCS has announced new grading procedures during the closure of schools due to COVID-19. Northwood Knights are all one
Group of dig-it-al folks!"
